news.title: Facebook Pulls Fake Accounts Ahead of Midterm Election
news.summary: Facebook said it deleted a new group of politically oriented accounts that were engaged in coordinated misinformation efforts ahead of the U.S. midterm elections that resemble Russian activities during the 2016 presidential campaign.

news.title: Chinese Economy Starts to Feel Impact of U.S. Tariffs
news.summary: China’s leadership pledged to ensure economic stability as its trade fight with the U.S. started to pinch growth, signaling that a bigger stimulus could be on the horizon.

news.title: Kelly Agrees to Remain Chief of Staff Through 2020 at Trump’s Request
news.summary: White House Chief of Staff John Kelly told staff that he agreed to a request from President Trump to remain in his post through the 2020 election, as tensions between the two men have eased in recent months.
news.byline: Rebecca Ballhaus, Byron Tau and Peter Nicholas

news.title: Apple Comes Under Media Fire in China Amid Rising Trade Tensions
news.summary: Chinese state media claims the U.S. tech giant isn’t doing enough to block texts and images trafficking in prohibited content.

news.title: Why Americans Spend So Much on Health Care—In 12 Charts
news.summary: Prices are hidden behind insurance deals, hospital consolidation pushes up costs and the health sector is a growing power in the economy.
news.byline: Joseph Walker | Graphics by Angela Calderon

news.title: Young People Don’t Want Construction Jobs. That’s a Problem for the Housing Market.
news.summary: The share of young construction workers declined nearly 30% from 2005 through 2016, contributing to a labor shortage that has meant fewer homes being built and rising prices.

news.title: U.S. Workers Get Biggest Pay Increase in Nearly a Decade
news.summary: American workers received their biggest pay raises in a nearly decade in the year to June, a sign the strong labor market and low unemployment is boosting wages as employers compete for scarcer workers.

news.title: Elon Musk Rebuts Critics, Teases Ideas and Stirs Controversy in 4,925 Tweets
news.summary: Tweeting @elonmusk? There’s a good chance he’ll reply to you, and the chief executive of Tesla isn’t afraid to court controversy when tweeting to his over 22 million followers. But don’t take him “too seriously.”

news.title: Nobody Says ‘Zelle Me’: Banks Struggle to Catch Up to Venmo
news.summary: Bank-backed Zelle says it “changes the way money moves.” But the money-transfer service has struggled to distinguish itself from the rivals it’s trying to fend off.

news.title: Ready, Aim, Hire a ‘Fortnite’ Coach: Parents Enlist Videogame Tutors for Their Children
news.summary: It’s not the violence or the addiction of the hit game that bothers mom and dad—it’s the losing.

news.title: P&G Shifts Strategy, Raises Prices
news.summary: Procter & Gamble is raising prices on some of its biggest brands, a strategy shift after it reported another quarter of lackluster growth.

news.title: Samsung’s Mobile Profit Falls as Consumers Balk at Costly Phones
news.summary: Fewer buyers than expected have shelled out top dollar for Samsung’s new flagship device, the Galaxy S9.

news.title: Qualcomm to Buy Back $10 Billion of Its Shares
news.summary: Qualcomm unveiled the first part of a share buyback program authorized last week after scrapping a bid to buy NXP Semiconductors.

news.title: What the #MeToo Allegations Mean for CBS
news.summary: he CBS board’s decision to investigate allegations against Les Moonves and further postpone a board meeting in which they likely would have faced the wrath of controlling shareholder Shari Redstone still leave her as the likely victor in a tie-up with Viacom.

news.title: Pfizer to Raise R&D Spending as Pipeline Focus Sharpens
news.summary: Pfizer plans to increase research and development spending and focus on smaller deals in a bid to accelerate the delivery of potential blockbuster treatments to market.
news.byline: Nishant Mohan and Jonathan D. Rockoff

news.title: President Attacks Kochs After GOP Donors Shy Away From Candidate
news.summary: President Trump lit into Charles and David Koch, some of the Republican Party’s top donors, after saying over the weekend that they wouldn’t financially back the GOP’s North Dakota senate candidate.

news.title: U.S. Forms New Cyber Hub to Protect Infrastructure
news.summary: The Department of Homeland Security announced the creation of a center aimed at guarding the nation’s banks, energy companies and other industries from major cyberattacks, with officials and analysts especially concerned about the threat to infrastructure posed by Russia.

news.title: Trump Voices Skepticism on Sale of 3-D Printed Guns
news.summary: President Trump voiced skepticism about the legal sale of 3-D printed plastic firearms, which gun-control groups say enable purchasers to avoid background checks.

news.title: Trump Agrees to Delay Fight Over Funding Wall
news.summary: President Trump has privately agreed to put off a potential shutdown or any fight over border wall funding until after the midterms.

news.title: Boy, Three Adults Shot Dead in Queens
news.summary: Four people, including a 5-year-old boy, were found fatally shot in a Queens home on Monday night in what investigators suspect was a domestic- violence incident.

news.title: SoftBank’s Vision Fund Hiring Deutsche Bank Saudi Unit Chief
news.summary: SoftBank is hiring the head of Deutsche Bank’s unit in Saudi Arabia to lead a new office in Riyadh, said people familiar with the matter, further deepening the partnership between the Japanese firm and the kingdom.

news.title: Credit Suisse on Track for First Annual Profit in Four Years
news.summary: Credit Suisse’s second-quarter profit more than doubled, putting it on track for its first annual profit since 2014, but the Swiss bank warned that geopolitical uncertainty and trade tensions could impact its market-sensitive businesses.

news.title: Trump Administration Embraces Fintech Startups
news.summary: The Trump administration embraced an emerging corner of the financial sector, telling companies that offer new ways to bank and invest that the federal government wants to help them grow.

news.title: Bank of America, Morgan Stanley to Invest in Luma Financial
news.summary: The two firms plan to announce that they are backing a new company, Luma Financial Technologies, to connect retail brokers seeking market-linked CDs, structured notes and other products to the banks that issue them.

news.title: Japan Inc. Is Decluttering—and Foreign Investors Love It
news.summary: Growing pressure to improve returns and corporate governance is straining the decades-old ownership ties that bind many public companies together, creating openings for foreign investors.

news.title: Chinese Surveillance Expands to Muslims Making Mecca Pilgrimage
news.summary: China’s close monitoring of its Islamic minority is being extended abroad, as Muslims from some Chinese regions make the Hajj pilgrimage wearing state-issued tracking devices.

news.title: Iranian Officials Rebuff Trump’s Offer for a Meeting
news.summary: Domestic pressure on Iranian President Hassan Rouhani to take a more hard-line stance toward the U.S. after Washington’s withdrawal from the nuclear deal gives him little leeway to accept President Trump’s offer to meet.
news.byline: Asa Fitch in Dubai and Aresu Eqbali in Tehran

news.title: Mexico’s New President Will Take a Pay Cut. That Means Cuts for Others.
news.summary: A plan by President-elect Andrés Manuel López Obrador to slash top government salaries threatens to gut the brain trust at institutions that have played pivotal roles in stabilizing Mexico’s economy.

news.title: U.S. Seeks to Avoid a Pakistan Bailout That Would Repay China
news.summary: Pakistan’s growing debt to China is emerging as a point of contention with the U.S. as the South Asian nation’s incoming leaders prepare to possibly seek an international financial bailout.

news.title: North Korea Expands Facilities at Missile Site
news.summary: North Korea has constructed two new buildings at a missile facility and appears to be actively continuing production there, the latest sign of continued progress in its nuclear and missile program.

news.title: Philippines Car Bombing Linked to Pro-Islamic State Group
news.summary: At least 10 people were killed in a powerful car bombing in the southern Philippines that officials linked to the Abu Sayyaf group, which tried to carve out a slice of territory in the south of the country last year.
news.byline: Jake Maxwell Watts and Ben Otto

news.title: Indonesia Bans Terror Group Behind Child Suicide Bombings
news.summary: Indonesia banned the militant group behind Islamic State’s first attack in Southeast Asia and suicide bombings involving children, a move that foreshadows the arrests of hundreds of the group’s members in the world’s largest Muslim-majority nation.

news.title: An Idyllic Artists’ Retreat that Invites Guests to Take in the View
news.summary: With help from architect David Chipperfield, Antony Gormley and Vicken Parsons have transformed an 18th-century villa in Norfolk, England into an inspiring retreat for artists.

news.title: Should I Sanitize My Smartphone?
news.summary: For all the grime that gets on our devices, the occasional wipe down might not be enough. These glowing gadgets give them a deeper clean.

news.title: Trouble Sleeping? High-Tech Masks Can Help
news.summary: These eye shades use light therapy to help reset your body clock so you can rest easy.

news.title: Pizza Delivery Gears Up for a Driverless Era
news.summary: Pizza companies are testing the use of autonomous vehicles to get their product to you. But there are still some kinks to work out.

news.title: AI Helps Cities Predict Natural Disasters
news.summary: New tools aim to forecast storm and earthquake damage, improving emergency response.

news.title: Home Price Gains Held Steady in May
news.summary: Home price gains held steady in May, as a lack of inventory of homes for sale helps prevent a meaningful slowdown in price growth despite rising mortgage rates and growing affordability challenges.

news.title: Former Warehouse in Chelsea Sells for $900 Million
news.summary: A joint venture of L&L Holding Co. and Normandy Real Estate Partners has agreed to pay about $900 million for a storied, former freight warehouse in Manhattan’s Chelsea neighborhood.

news.title: Eurozone Economy Slows Further as Exports Sputter
news.summary: The eurozone’s economy slowed further in the three months through June, as exports sputtered and business confidence weakened on worries over future relations with the currency area’s largest trading partners.

news.title: Mexican Economy Slipped in Second Quarter
news.summary: Mexico’s economic output shrank slightly in the second quarter as a decline in industrial production offset gains in services.

news.title: Canada GDP Rose in May, Beating Expectations
news.summary: The Canadian economy advanced at a faster pace than expected in May on widespread gains across most sectors, raising expectations for another interest-rate rise this year.

news.title: China Regulator’s Vaccine Reassurance Backfires
news.summary: China’s food and drug watchdog, looking to restore public confidence in its vaccine oversight Tuesday, instead set off a fresh social-media uproar.

news.title: Zimbabweans Turn Out in Droves for First Vote Without Mugabe
news.summary: Millions of voters marked their ballot papers in their first election without ousted strongman Robert Mugabe’s name at the top—and, many said, without the widespread intimidation that had marred previous polls.

news.title: Mexico’s Murder Rate Hits Highest Level in Decades
news.summary: The number of murders in Mexico rose sharply last year, pushing the homicide rate to its highest level since at least 1990.

news.title: New Militant Group Threatens Gas Projects, Villages in Mozambique
news.summary: A new group of Islamist militants has killed and displaced villagers on Mozambique’s northern coast, threatening an emerging natural-gas sector that has attracted $50 billion in investment.

news.title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 Report Leaves Families in Dark Four Years On
news.summary: Investigators probing the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 found no fault with the pilots or aircraft, but they had no explanation for what happened to the plane and the 239 people on board, and didn’t rule out the possibility of “unlawful interference” of the flight.

news.title: Iran’s Rial at Historic Low as U.S. Sanctions Loom
news.summary: Iran’s local currency hit another record low against the U.S. dollar, extending a historic slide on concerns about new sanctions due to be imposed next week.
news.byline: Asa Fitch in Dubai and Aresu Eqbali in Tehran

news.title: China Indicts Former Top Internet Regulator on Corruption Charges
news.summary: Prosecutors indicted China’s former top internet regulator on charges that he took bribes and abused his power, advancing a case portrayed as a sign of President Xi Jinping’s continuing commitment to his far-reaching anticorruption campaign.

news.title: Australian Archbishop Resigns After Sex-Abuse Coverup Conviction
news.summary: Pope Francis accepted the resignation of an Australian archbishop convicted of concealing sex abuse, in the Catholic Church’s latest response to an international scandal over sexual abuse and harassment.
news.byline: Francis X. Rocca in Rome and Rob Taylor in Canberra

news.title: Cambodian Strongman Claims Victory in Widely Criticized Election
news.summary: After locking up his chief rival, Prime Minister Hun Sen claimed another five years as Cambodia’s leader, in an election that was widely derided as a farce exposing the lurch toward authoritarianism.

news.title: Italy Threatens to Bring Down EU-Canada Free Trade Deal
news.summary: Italy’s new government wants to reject a painstakingly negotiated trade deal between the European Union and Canada, and that is welcome news to many small farmers in Italy’s fertile north.

news.title: Doubts Hang Over Zimbabwe’s Post-Mugabe Vote
news.summary: Whether Monday’s presidential election will be spared the violence and alleged rigging that marred polls in Zimbabwe under ousted strongman Robert Mugabe has become the central question of the vote.

news.title: Trump Willing to Meet Iran’s President With No Conditions
news.summary: President Trump said he would be willing to meet with his Iranian counterpart without first demanding diplomatic concessions, the latest public overture involving nations he once condemned.

news.title: Koch Donor Network Won’t Back GOP Candidate in North Dakota Race
news.summary: The conservative donor network founded by the billionaire Koch brothers won’t support a GOP contender in a close Congressional midterm race, saying he doesn’t follow Koch ideology on spending and tariffs.

news.title: Giuliani Says Trump Wants an Interview in the Russia Probe
news.summary: Mueller has yet to respond to an offer setting conditions on questions, the president’s lawyer says

news.title: Wilkie Sworn In as VA Head
news.summary: Department of Veterans Affairs Secretary Robert Wilkie was sworn in Monday, taking the helm of a department undergoing extensive changes and with key leadership positions still unfilled.

news.title: Kavanaugh Meets With Key Senate Democrat
news.summary: Manchin of West Virginia, who is running for re-election, is the first member of his party to meet with the Supreme Court nominee

news.title: Chinese Investors Pulled Back in U.S. in 2017
news.summary: The cumulative level of Chinese investment in the U.S. declined in 2017, according to a new Commerce Department report, adding to evidence that tensions between Beijing and Washington are damping enthusiasm of Chinese investors for American assets.

news.title: U.S. to ‘Deepen Engagement’ in Asia, Pompeo Says
news.summary: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said in a speech that the U.S. was committed to growing trade and investment in Asia, and he assured potential strategic and trade partners the U.S. wants partnership, not domination.

news.title: What Duluth Can Teach America About Declining Political Civility
news.summary: More than a decade ago, Duluth’s rancorous politics prompted a call for more civilized discourse that has endured to today, Gerald F. Seib writes.

news.title: Republican Women Push to Bolster Dwindling Numbers
news.summary: With more than a quarter of the current 23 House Republican women leaving Congress after this year, GOP women are working to replenish their ranks in primary elections like Thursday’s crowded showdown in a Knoxville,Tenn., district.

news.title: Trump Allies Take Aim at Michael Cohen After Fallout
news.summary: President Trump’s allies sought to discredit his former attorney, Michael Cohen, after a week of escalating clashes that raised the question of how much Mr. Cohen will divulge about his former boss.

news.title: Trump Adviser Kudlow Says U.S. to ‘Immediately’ Start EU Trade Talks on Agriculture
news.summary: A top Trump administration official said Sunday that the U.S. will “immediately” start negotiating with the European Union to forge trade agreements on farm and energy products.

news.title: Kansas Race Splits GOP
news.summary: President Trump is shaking up races in Kansas, where Republicans locked in a bitter gubernatorial primary are jockeying over loyalty to him and Democrats are seeking to use opposition to him to flip two U.S. House seats.

news.title: Trump Again Threatens to Shut Down Government
news.summary: President Trump renewed a threat to shut down the government unless Congress provides money for a border wall and enacts new immigration curbs.​

news.title: Lawmakers’ Summer Break Is Colored by Trump Effect
news.summary: With roughly 100 days to go until the midterm elections, both Republicans and Democrats will be treading carefully in how they engage with voters on issues associated with President Trump.

news.title: Trump ‘Open to Visiting Moscow’ if Formally Invited, White House Says
news.summary: The president is open to an invitation from Vladimir Putin to visit Moscow, a White House spokeswoman said Friday, days after his invitation to the Russian leader to visit Washington prompted bipartisan criticism.

news.title: New Poll Puts Cuomo Ahead of Nixon in Governor’s Race
news.summary: Six weeks ahead of New York’s Democratic primaries, Gov. Andrew Cuomo maintains a large lead over rival Cynthia Nixon, according to a new poll.

news.title: New York City’s ‘Little Haiti’ Makes a Big Impression
news.summary: The city’s newest officially-designated ethnic neighborhood lies in the heart of Brooklyn. It’s a bit off the grid, but offers rewards for the intrepid explorer.

news.title: Eight States Sue to Block Release of Plans for 3D-Printed Guns
news.summary: Eight states filed suit to block a pro-gun group from distributing files online for making firearms with 3D printers.

news.title: Lawmaker Seeks to Expand Gifted Programs in New York City
news.summary: A new bill in the New York State Senate aims to require New York City to expand its gifted programs at elementary and middle schools to help more students better compete for selective public high schools.

news.title: New Jersey Warehouse Rents Hit Fresh High
news.summary: Asking rents in New Jersey’s hot warehouse market hit a high in the second quarter as e-commerce businesses expand and industrial tenants devour new space even before it hits the market.

news.title: ‘Pretty Woman’ Draws Crowd in First Week of Previews
news.summary: “Pretty Woman,” the show based on the 1990 romantic comedy that starred Julia Roberts and Richard Gere, played to 98% capacity and grossed slightly more than $1 million in its first full week of previews.

news.title: Bronx Gets Bike-Share Program with Electric ‘Pedal Assist’
news.summary: Dockless bikes rolled out in the Bronx, fulfilling New York City’s goal of expanding bike sharing to all five boroughs and setting the stage for a competition between some of the nation’s leading bike-share companies.

news.title: Top U.S. Universities Back Harvard in Affirmative-Action Case
news.summary: Sixteen prestigious U.S. universities argued in a court filing that any prohibitions on considering race in admissions decisions would be an “extraordinary intrusion” by the federal government.

news.title: Pennsylvania Pediatrician Faces New Child Abuse Charges
news.summary: Pennsylvania pediatrician Johnnie Wilson Barto faces dozens of child molestation charges after police say more victims have come forward to allege he sexually abused them.

news.title: Family of Duck Boat Victims Sues Tour Operator
news.summary: The relatives of nine family members killed in a Missouri boating accident sued the operators of the duck-style tour boat.

news.title: Top Lawyers Evade Harassment Claims
news.summary: Law firms stand out in a corporate landscape where rainmakers accused of sexual harassment often receive second and third chances, according to interviews with dozens of people at some of the country’s largest firms.

news.title: Wildfires Scorch California as Death Toll Rises to Six
news.summary: Wildfires spread across California, forcing officials to extend closure of the famed Yosemite Valley by another week and maintain evacuations for thousands of people farther north around Redding where the death toll climbed to at least six.

news.title: Move the Furniture, It’s Time for a Drone Race
news.summary: A handful of informal drone-racing locations have popped up around New York City, from a Tex-Mex restaurant in Hell’s Kitchen to a digital-imaging studio in Chelsea.

news.title: Koch Network Criticizes Trump Trade Policy at Donor Meeting
news.summary: Billionaire Charles Koch warned against protectionism Sunday at a biannual meeting of the conservative network he co-founded.

news.title: Manafort’s Finances Will Be in Spotlight in High-Stakes Trial
news.summary: Special counsel Robert Mueller’s team will take President Trump’s former campaign chairman Paul Manafort to court in Alexandria, Va., on Tuesday, in a trial with implications reaching far beyond the immediate charges ranging from tax evasion to bank fraud.

news.title: Flatiron District Gets Back to Business After Steam-Pipe Explosion
news.summary: Businesses are reopening but foot traffic remains light following a steam-pipe explosion on July 19 in Manhattan’s Flatiron District.

news.title: Sony’s Profit Soars on PlayStation Strength
news.summary: Sony reported another strong quarter of earnings, buoyed by stable sales of electronics hardware, strength in its PlayStation videogame business and demand for smartphone camera components.

news.title: Tesla Explores Building Major Factory in Europe
news.summary: Tesla Inc.’s international expansion is gaining momentum, with authorities in Germany and the Netherlands initiating talks with the company to build its first major European factory.
news.byline: William Boston in Berlin and Tim Higgins in San Francisco

news.title: Samsung Electronics Posts Flat Second-Quarter Net Profit
news.summary: Samsung Electronics Co. reported flat second-quarter net profits, as a big drop in mobile phone profits dragged down results that were again buoyed by its strength in memory chips.

news.title: Facebook’s Next Challenge: Less Data to Target Ads
news.summary: Facebook’s advertisers in Europe are on the front lines of its efforts to tighten privacy practices, and their frustrations help explain why the social-media giant’s troubles are far from over.

news.title: Starbucks Ties Up With Alibaba to Deliver Coffee in China
news.summary: Starbucks is joining with e-commerce giant Alibaba to deliver beverages and snacks, as it seeks to reverse a sales decline in China.

news.title: Jack Ma’s Giant Financial Startup Is Shaking the Chinese Banking System
news.summary: Ant Financial, which grew out of Alibaba, controls the world’s largest money-market fund, handled more payments last year than Mastercard and is more valuable than Goldman Sachs. Its power and disruptive capacity is drawing a backlash from Chinese banks—and also the government.

news.title: GE to Shed Parts of Digital Unit
news.summary: General Electric is seeking a buyer for key parts of its digital business as the beleaguered industrial conglomerate unwinds a signature initiative of former Chief Executive Jeff Immelt.
news.byline: Dana Cimilluca, Dana Mattioli and Thomas Gryta

news.title: Investors Step Back From Social-Media Highfliers
news.summary: Shares of Twitter and Facebook endured a surprise rout this week, as investors were rattled by signs that users are souring on the social-media stalwarts.
news.byline: Marc Vartabedian, Yoree Koh and Michael Wursthorn

news.title: Walmart Explores Video Streaming
news.summary: Walmart is exploring a video-streaming service that would seek to challenge Netflix and Amazon by offering programming that targets Middle America.
news.byline: Joe Flint, Erich Schwartzel and Sarah Nassauer

news.title: Alibaba Shares Remain Out of Reach in China, For Now
news.summary: China’s ambitious plan to lure technology giants back home is languishing, with companies and regulator blaming each other and a weaker stock market.
news.byline: Chao Deng, Liza Lin and Julie Steinberg

news.title: NXP Was a Popular Hedge-Fund Trade Before Deal Collapsed
news.summary: Qualcomm’s potential deal to buy Dutch chip maker NXP Semiconductors attracted some of the hedge fund industry’s biggest names before it collapsed this week.

news.title: Intel Serves Up an Opportunity for AMD
news.summary: Much smaller chip maker will have a big head start with new data-center processors.

news.title: Retail Returns Specialist Optoro Raises $75 Million in New Funding
news.summary: Franklin Templeton is leading an infusion backing Optoro’s expansion in a market growing more prominent as e-commerce raises the role of returned merchandise in retailing.

news.title: Apple Expected to Report Modest iPhone Growth
news.summary: Apple Inc. is scheduled to report results for its fiscal third quarter after the market closes Tuesday. Here’s what you need to know.

news.title: This Camera Crushes Your Phone—and Still Fits in Your Pocket
news.summary: The remarkable thing about Sony’s new RX100 is that it packs so many features into a body much closer in size to a smartphone than a chunky DSLR. At $1,200 it’s pricey, writes David Pierce, but the RX100 VI may be the best camera you can take anywhere.

news.title: Amazon HQ2: Finding the Perfect Match
news.summary: Which North American town, city or region wooing Amazon will be the location of its next headquarters? This video explains what the company is looking for in a headquarters match and how cities are trying to win its love.

news.title: How Sellers Trick Amazon to Boost Sales
news.summary: Every day, dozens of young men crowd into tiny rooms with 30 computers each in northern Bangladesh. Their mission: Trick Amazon.com.
news.byline: Laura Stevens in San Francisco and Jon Emont in Hong Kong

news.title: Investors Look to Apple After FANG Index Slides Into Correction Territory
news.summary: Investors will be closely watching Apple’s earnings late Tuesday after a closely watched stock index of global technology giants tumbled into correction territory.

news.title: In Second Act, a Silicon Valley CEO Opens Up About Affairs
news.summary: Former SoFi chief Mike Cagney admits misleading the lender’s board over an affair, as he debuts his latest financial-technology startup, Figure, with his wife.

news.title: Ousted Tech Founder? Uber’s Travis Kalanick Is in Good Company
news.summary: Uber co-Founder Travis Kalanick joins an illustrious list of Silicon Valley leaders forced out of running the companies they built.

news.title: Uber’s Really Bad Year
news.summary: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick’s resignation follows a turbulent few months for both him and the company he founded. Here’s a quick glance at the events that preceded the 40-year-old’s departure.

news.title: Biggest Companies’ Secret to Success: Their Tech Spending
news.summary: The secret of success for Amazon, Google and Microsoft is how much they invest in their own technology.

news.title: ‘The Mobile Industry’s Never Seen Anything Like This’: Steve Jobs on the App Store
news.summary: As the App Store turns 10, we revisit the Apple CEO’s 2008 interview with Nick Wingfield shortly after its launch. “There’s never been a mobile platform that’s been this powerful before,” he says. Get the full audio and transcript.

news.title: Nintendo Operating Profit Jumps 88% Despite Softer Switch Sales
news.summary: Nintendo said its operating profit nearly doubled in the fiscal first quarter as strong game-software sales more than offset a falloff for its main Switch game console. Net profit was up 44%.

news.title: Baidu Earnings: What to Watch
news.summary: Baidu is scheduled to report second-quarter earnings after the U.S. market closes Tuesday. Here’s what you need to know.

news.title: U.K. Report Calls for More Oversight of Tech Companies Such as Facebook
news.summary: A new report from the U.K. Parliament calls for tech companies to be liable for harmful and misleading material on their platforms, warning of a “democratic crisis” being created by the spread of misinformation.

news.title: Twitter Shares Fall Sharply on Warning on Declining Users
news.summary: Twitter shares fell more than 20% as the social-media company said its number of monthly users dropped in the second quarter and could keep falling as it purges fake accounts.

news.title: Facebook Temporarily Bans Alex Jones Over Video Posts
news.summary: Facebook banned controversial radio host Alex Jones for 30 days for repeatedly posting content that violated the social network’s community guidelines.

news.title: Arconic Shops Unit That Made Panels in Grenfell Fire
news.summary: Arconic Inc. said Tuesday it is looking to sell the business that made the aluminum panels involved in the deadly June 2017 Grenfell Tower fire in London

news.title: U.S. Executives Keep Hoarding Cash as Trade Tensions Unfold
news.summary: Executives at U.S. companies continued to accumulate cash in the second quarter, in a sign of wariness around escalating trade tensions, according to a new survey.

news.title: Food Retailer Supervalu Settles With Activist
news.summary: Investment firm Blackwells suspends its campaign as the food retailer and distributor prepares to sell.

news.title: Levi’s Plans to Slash Emissions in Global Supply Chain by 2025
news.summary: The apparel giant aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions at a sprawling set of factories and mills in 39 countries, starting with first-tier suppliers.

news.title: Motorcycles Are Helping Honda Get a Handle on Tariffs
news.summary: Like others in the car industry, Honda is getting hit by higher prices caused by U.S. metals tariffs. Unlike others, motorcycle sales are helping it ease the pain.

news.title: ComScore to Debut First Ad Product Under New CEO
news.summary: ComScore is preparing to launch a new product that measures ad views across platforms like TV and mobile, the first big move by new Chief Executive Bryan Wiener, who has been charged with turning around the beleaguered business.

news.title: Out of Stock Online? Zara Will Ship From Stores Instead
news.summary: Fast-fashion giant Zara is equipping its stores to also ship online purchases, betting that the move will boost sales of full-priced items that can be delivered to customers more quickly than from a warehouse.

news.title: BP Earnings Boosted by Higher Oil Prices
news.summary: BP said second-quarter profit jumped, as higher oil prices helped the company push its ambitious growth plans.

news.title: Tyson Cuts Outlook on Tariffs, Commodity Volatility
news.summary: Tyson Foods said tariffs have hurt domestic and export prices on chicken and pork. The company also said domestic chicken demand has weakened because of an abundance of “relatively lower-priced” beef and pork.

news.title: Caterpillar Profit Surges, Absorbs Tariff-Related Cost Increases
news.summary: Caterpillar raised its profit outlook for the year as strong machinery sales in a buoyant global economy offset increased raw-material costs related to tariffs.

news.title: Harley Plans Smaller Motorcycles to Woo Young Riders
news.summary: The motorcycle maker will introduce a line of middleweight motorcycles and also plans to make small motorcycles for the Asian market.

news.title: Kroger Unit Won’t Take Visa Credit Cards in California Stores
news.summary: A unit of supermarket chain Kroger Co. said Monday it will stop accepting Visa Inc. credit cards at 21 stores and five gas stations in California due to the card giant’s fees.

news.title: CBS to Appoint Law Firm to Handle Probe Into Moonves Allegations
news.summary: CBS said its board of directors was in the process of selecting an outside law firm to handle an independent investigation into allegations Chief Executive Leslie Moonves sexually harassed women.

news.title: US Foods to Buy Five Food Businesses for $1.8 Billion
news.summary: US Foods has agreed to buy five food businesses from Services Group of America in a $1.8 billion deal that will boost its presence in the Northwest.

news.title: Vivendi to Explore Selling Up to 50% of Universal Music Group
news.summary: The move is a stark turnaround for the French media conglomerate, and an attempt to cash in on a resurgence in the music business.
news.byline: Nick Kostov in Paris and Anne Steele in Los Angeles

news.title: Johnson & Johnson Adds Zarbee’s Naturals to Bolster Consumer Brands
news.summary: Johnson & Johnson’s consumer-health arm reached a deal to buy children’s cough-syrup maker Zarbee’s Naturals, a move that could help the company better reach health-conscious millennial parents and bolster sales from the unit.

news.title: MGM Makes Wager on Sports Betting
news.summary: MGM Resorts said it would partner with Britain’s GVC to set up a U.S. sports betting and online-gambling business, the latest wager that Americans will gamble more after a landmark court ruling earlier this year.

news.title: Stocks Higher on Trade Optimism
news.summary: U.S. stocks edged higher on a report that the U.S. and China will return to trade discussions, while the technology sector started to bounce back after a three-session downturn.
news.byline: Ben St. Clair and Allison Prang

news.title: NYSE Probe of Alleged Kickbacks Revives Old Questions
news.summary: An alleged kickback scheme at the New York Stock Exchange has revived old questions about whether the Big Board’s floor traders are lining their pockets at investors’ expense.

news.title: Apple Could’ve Been a Trillionaire Long Ago
news.summary: Buybacks and dividends have rewarded shareholders but probably cost the tech giant the distinction of already being the first company with 13 digits.

news.title: Standard Chartered Sees Positive Side to U.S.-China Trade Dispute
news.summary: Standard Chartered said the continuing trade dispute between the U.S. and China is causing clients to delay investment decisions but could be good for the bank over time as more trade is routed between Asian countries.

news.title: GAM Shares Fall 20% After Fund Manager’s Suspension
news.summary: GAM shares fell around 20% after the Swiss money-management firm said it had suspended one of its investment directors following an internal investigation, warning the action could lead some investors to pull money out.

news.title: Short Seller Who Slammed Samsonite Takes Swipe at New Target
news.summary: Investor Soren Aandahl, who made a splash earlier this year for attacking luggage maker Samsonite, is shorting GDS Holdings, a provider of data-center infrastructure and services in China.

news.title: U.S. Bonds Gain on Central Bank Support
news.summary: U.S. government bonds rose Tuesday after the Bank of Japan made only slight adjustments to its regime of easy monetary policy and a key measure of inflation declined.

news.title: P&G Washout May Run Another Cycle
news.summary: Procter & Gamble is raising prices on some of its biggest brands and forecasting a rebound in growth, but there are many reasons to stay skeptical.

news.title: Copper Rises on Report of Easing Trade Tensions
news.summary: The metal rose 0.9% to $2.8170 a pound, erasing earlier losses. Prices have rebounded slightly since hitting their lowest level in more than a year earlier this month.

news.title: Dollar Higher After Inflation Data
news.summary: The dollar rose Tuesday morning after June inflation data fell in line with expectations on the first day of the Federal Reserve’s policy meeting.

news.title: Oil Prices Decline as Investors Await U.S. Stockpiles Data
news.summary: Oil prices dropped below $69 a barrel as investors weighed declining U.S. inventories against signs of rising output from OPEC and Russia.

news.title: Brookfield Asset Management to Acquire Forest City
news.summary: Brookfield Asset Management has agreed to buy real-estate developer Forest City Realty Trust in a transaction valued at $11.4 billion including debt.

news.title: The Hidden Risks of China’s Private Sector Debt Crisis
news.summary: Last time Chinese debt spooked global markets, the problem was lumbering state-owned factories. This time private companies are suffering, which has worrying implications for long-term growth.

news.title: Chinese Investors Bid Up Prices Locally as They Bring Capital Home
news.summary: Chinese investors have been buying commercial property domestically at the fastest rate ever as new institutions and funds join the market and traditional players focus more on their home shores.

news.title: China’s Online Retail Giants Expand Bricks-and-Mortar Push
news.summary: The biggest online retailers in China are buying and building big portfolios of convenience stores, supermarkets and department stores, embracing a much more expansive bricks-and-mortar strategy than their U.S. counterparts.

news.title: Theme Park Developments in China Hit Crossroads: Real or Pixie Dust?
news.summary: Local governments across China have long relied on theme parks as a way to stoke real-estate development, but that strategy is facing new pressure as Beijing becomes more wary of the risks, such as developers’ taking on too much debt.

news.title: MoviePass to raise subscription fee, limit ticket availability to some films in cost-reducing measure
People like meal kits, but their business model is unsustainable
Gold prices up for the session, down for a fourth straight month
Avant-Garde South London Home of Steel, Concrete List for £1.95M
Futuristic Kitchen Islands
A Villa with a Vineyard in Southern California
What Does It Take to Land a Final Four? Some Really Big Curtains
news.summary: New stadiums use large swaths of glass or high-tech see-through material, but NCAA doesn’t want so much light; a $5 million ‘darkening solution’

news.title: The Pension Hole for U.S. Cities and States Is the Size of Japan’s Economy
news.summary: Many retirement funds could face insolvency unless governments increase taxes, divert funds or persuade workers to relinquish money they are owed. The problem, once a hypothetical, would hit retirees for whom it’s too late to engineer a Plan B.

news.title: GE to Shed Parts of Digital Unit
news.summary: General Electric is seeking a buyer for key parts of its digital business as the beleaguered industrial conglomerate unwinds a signature initiative of former Chief Executive Jeff Immelt.
news.byline: Dana Cimilluca, Dana Mattioli and Thomas Gryta

news.title: Top Lawyers Evade Harassment Claims
news.summary: Law firms stand out in a corporate landscape where rainmakers accused of sexual harassment often receive second and third chances, according to interviews with dozens of people at some of the country’s largest firms.

news.title: After Eating at 99 of the World’s Best Restaurants, a Gourmet Whiffs at 100
news.summary: Paul Grinberg, party of one, has dined on alligator tendon, shark belly, ants, sperm sacks and brains at Michelin-starred restaurants world-wide in his quest to eat at 100 of the best. The last one has yet to seat him.

news.title: Chinese Economy Starts to Feel Impact of U.S. Tariffs
news.summary: China’s leadership pledged to ensure economic stability as its trade fight with the U.S. started to pinch growth, signaling that a bigger stimulus could be on the horizon.

news.title: Young People Don’t Want Construction Jobs. That’s a Problem for the Housing Market.
news.summary: The share of young construction workers declined nearly 30% from 2005 through 2016, contributing to a labor shortage that has meant fewer homes being built and rising prices.

news.title: Amazon HQ2: Finding the Perfect Match
news.summary: Which North American town, city or region wooing Amazon will be the location of its next headquarters? This video explains what the company is looking for in a headquarters match and how cities are trying to win its love.

news.title: Investors Look to Apple After FANG Index Slides Into Correction Territory
news.summary: Investors will be closely watching Apple’s earnings late Tuesday after a closely watched stock index of global technology giants tumbled into correction territory.

news.title: Mexico’s Murder Rate Hits Highest Level in Decades
news.summary: The number of murders in Mexico rose sharply last year, pushing the homicide rate to its highest level since at least 1990.

news.title: Home Shark Tanks Are In. Just One Problem: Sharks Make Terrible Pets
news.summary: Sharks are the new hot feature for wealthy homeowners. But keeping a pet with that many teeth doesn’t always go swimmingly— especially for the other fish. “Messing with the vibe of the tank.”

news.title: Employers Eager to Hire Try a New Policy: ‘No Experience Necessary’
news.summary: More companies, desperate for candidates for jobs ranging from auto mechanic to e-commerce analyst, are abandoning requirements about experience and college degrees.

news.title: Jack Ma’s Giant Financial Startup Is Shaking the Chinese Banking System
news.summary: Ant Financial, which grew out of Alibaba, controls the world’s largest money-market fund, handled more payments last year than Mastercard and is more valuable than Goldman Sachs. Its power and disruptive capacity is drawing a backlash from Chinese banks—and also the government.

news.title: Why Americans Spend So Much on Health Care—In 12 Charts
news.summary: Prices are hidden behind insurance deals, hospital consolidation pushes up costs and the health sector is a growing power in the economy.
news.byline: Joseph Walker | Graphics by Angela Calderon

news.title: Trump Willing to Meet Iran’s President With No Conditions
news.summary: President Trump said he would be willing to meet with his Iranian counterpart without first demanding diplomatic concessions, the latest public overture involving nations he once condemned.

news.title: What Duluth Can Teach America About Declining Political Civility
news.summary: More than a decade ago, Duluth’s rancorous politics prompted a call for more civilized discourse that has endured to today, Gerald F. Seib writes.

news.title: Goldman Partners’ Haul on Crisis-Era Options: $3 Billion
news.summary: Goldman Sachs’s last batch of crisis-era stock options will have earned top current or former executives at least $3 billion by the time they expire later this year.

news.title: Three Important Primary Races to Watch in Tennessee
news.summary: On Thursday, Tennessee voters will choose nominees for state and federal office. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib looks at the races for governor, Senate and House. Photo: Getty

news.title: Paraplegic Veteran Gets His Wheels Back
news.summary: Richard Neider, an Army veteran and paraplegic, thought he would never ride again. But with his new Indian Scout Bobber motorcycle, complete with wheelchair mount, he proved himself wrong. Photo: Steve Craft for The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Amazon HQ2: What City Will Win Jeff Bezos’ Heart?
news.summary: As Amazon searches for a location for its new headquarters—dubbed HQ2—cities across the country have been trying to woo the tech giant. At stake: 50,000 jobs and $5 billion in investments.

news.title: Can Grownups Do the Floss?
news.summary: Russell Horning, aka "The Backpack Kid" known for his performance of the floss, says adults just don't have the coordination or the flexibility to do it right. We asked a choreographer to put some families to the test. Video/Photo: Mark Kelly/The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Sync Your Camera and Phone for Better Photography
news.summary: There are plenty of good reasons to use a dedicated camera, but your smartphone should still be part of your photo workflow. WSJ's David Pierce shows you the accessories and apps to make it work. Photo/Video: Emily Prapuolenis/The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Geraint Thomas Wins the Tour de France for Team Sky
news.summary: The Welshman outdid Chris Froome, his teammate and four-time champion, to take his first Grand Tour title. Photo: Getty Images

news.title: Tour de France: The Mind Boggling Road to Paris
news.summary: After three weeks at the Tour, it's easy for riders to forget where they are or even what day it is. Photo: George Downs/The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Pakistan Elections: What's Next?
news.summary: Former cricket star Imran Khan claimed victory in a sharply contested election in Pakistan, the second ever transfer of power between civilian governments in the country's history. Here's what could be next for the fragile democracy. Photo: AFP/Getty Images

news.title: Tour de France: When the Cycling Circus Comes to Town
news.summary: The world's most famous bike race takes over 37 towns and cities this year and setting the stage for each start and finish requires military precision. Watch as the circus rolls into the sleepy French town of Millau. Video/Photo: George Downs/The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Trump Praises Economic Growth
news.summary: President Trump touted the strength of the U.S. economy at the White House Friday after GDP grew 4.1% in the second quarter. Photo: Getty

news.title: Amazon HQ2: Which City Will Win Jeff Bezos' Heart?
news.summary: As Amazon searches for a location for its new headquarters—dubbed HQ2—cities across the country have been trying to woo the tech giant. At stake: 50,000 jobs and $5 billion in investments.

news.title: Paraplegic Veteran Gets His Wheels Back
news.summary: Richard Neider, an Army veteran and paraplegic, thought he would never ride again. But with his new Indian Scout Bobber motorcycle, complete with wheelchair mount, he proved himself wrong. Photo: Steve Craft for The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Sync Your Camera and Phone for Better Photography
news.summary: There are plenty of good reasons to use a dedicated camera, but your smartphone should still be part of your photo workflow. WSJ's David Pierce shows you the accessories and apps to make it work. Photo/Video: Emily Prapuolenis/The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Can Grownups Do the Floss?
news.summary: Russell Horning, aka "The Backpack Kid" known for his performance of the floss, says adults just don't have the coordination or the flexibility to do it right. We asked a choreographer to put some families to the test. Video/Photo: Mark Kelly/The Wall Street Journal

news.title: This 22-Acre Island is Montana's Largest Private Estate
news.summary: Shelter Island is home to Montana's largest private estate, which was completed in 2011.

news.title: Three Important Primary Races to Watch in Tennessee
news.summary: On Thursday, Tennessee voters will choose nominees for state and federal office. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib looks at the races for governor, Senate and House. Photo: Getty

news.title: Geraint Thomas Wins the Tour de France for Team Sky
news.summary: The Welshman outdid Chris Froome, his teammate and four-time champion, to take his first Grand Tour title. Photo: Getty Images

news.title: Highlights From Facebook's Stock-Sinking Earnings Call
news.summary: Comments from Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and CFO David Wehner on the company’s second-quarter 2018 earnings call Wednesday cast serious doubt about the social network’s seemingly unstoppable growth. Photo: Getty Images

news.title: How Apple Fixed the New MacBook Pro Keyboard
news.summary: Apple's expensive new laptops feature the latest ideas about keyboards. WSJ's David Pierce looked inside the newest MacBook Pro to see how it's changed, and what it might mean for your typing fingers. Photo/Video: Emily Prapuolenis/The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Pakistan Elections: What's Next?
news.summary: Former cricket star Imran Khan claimed victory in a sharply contested election in Pakistan, the second ever transfer of power between civilian governments in the country's history. Here's what could be next for the fragile democracy. Photo: AFP/Getty Images

news.title: WPP Veteran Read Has Emerged as Leading CEO Choice
news.summary: WPP PLC executive Mark Read has emerged as the leading contender to take over as chief executive of the advertising giant, according to people familiar with the matter, following the departure of founder Martin Sorrell.

news.title: Facebook’s Challenge: Draw More Ad Dollars Beyond Core Platform
news.summary: With Facebook’s relentless growth no longer a given on its main platform, the social-media titan now faces a question that was previously an afterthought: How to squeeze more money from its other apps and services?

news.title: Amazon’s Profit Soars to Record
news.summary: Amazon’s profit topped $2 billion for the first time, powered by the company’s newer services businesses that are ushering it into an era of swelling profitability.

news.title: AMC Partners With Sorenson to Sell Targeted TV Ads
news.summary: AMC will be able to serve different ads to different households using Sorenson technology, and charge a premium

news.title: Viewers Cut the Cable TV Cord Faster Than Expected
news.summary: Research firm estimates the ranks of U.S. cord-cutters will grow this year by 8 million, or nearly 33%, to 33 million.

news.title: IPG Delivers a Dose of Good News for an Ad Industry Facing Challenges
news.summary: Interpublic Group of Cos. beat expectations for the second quarter and raised its forecast for the year.

news.title: WPP in Talks to Sell Minority Stake in Chinese Unit
news.summary: WPP has held talks to sell a minority stake in its operations in China, as the world’s largest advertising company reviews its business after founder Martin Sorrell’s exit.

news.title: Shares in Ad Giants Fall as Publicis Sales Disappoint
news.summary: Shares in some of the biggest ad companies tumbled after Publicis reported revenue below expectations, heightening investors’ concerns.

news.title: Big Advertisers Embrace Blockchain to Root Out Digital Spending Waste
news.summary: Nestle, Anheuser-Busch and Bayer are among the big consumer marketers using blockchain to avoid the so-called advertising tech tax, or wasted spending on digital ads.

news.title: Private-Equity Firm Silver Lake Offers to Invest $500 Million in iHeartMedia
news.summary: Private-equity firm Silver Lake has reached out to iHeartMedia and its largest creditor group with an offer to invest about $500 million in the radio station operator.

news.title: Startup Thinks Blockchain Can Help Fix the Media’s Business Woes
news.summary: The company is trying to sell a maximum of $34 million in “tokens,” digital currency that its owners can use in a new online marketplace for media ventures being created by the company.

news.title: Omnicom Boosts Data Effort With New Marketing Platform
news.summary: Ad giant Omnicom has created a one-stop-shop for its agencies and clients to create, plan and execute campaigns using reams of third-party data.

news.title: Fox Losing Money on World Cup Without U.S. Team
news.summary: 21st Century Fox is expected to lose money on covering the World Cup after early rounds of the no-U.S.-squad tournament drew nearly a third fewer viewers than in 2014.

news.title: WPP Has a New Rival: Its Founder
news.summary: The bitter breakup between advertising giant WPP and Martin Sorrell took another turn after Mr. Sorrell outbid his former company for Dutch digital production firm MediaMonks.

news.title: Sorrell Outbids WPP to Win MediaMonks
news.summary: Martin Sorrell’s new marketing venture has agreed to acquire a Netherlands-based digital production agency, topping a rival bid from his former company WPP.

news.title: Ad-Tech Company MediaMath Raises $225 Million
news.summary: The New York-based firm will use the capital to buy out an investor, spend on technology and fund acquisitions

news.title: WPP, Sorrell Submit Rival Bids for Digital Creative Agency
news.summary: WPP and former CEO Martin Sorrell are already competing against each other: the ad giant and Sorrell’s new venture have submitted offers for digital-creative agency MediaMonks.

news.title: IPG to Acquire Acxiom Division for $2.3 Billion
news.summary: Interpublic Group of Cos has agreed to acquire Acxiom Corp.’s Marketing Solutions business unit in a cash transaction valued at $2.3 billion, the company announced Monday afternoon.

news.title: Hertz Names New CIO as Tech Overhaul Continues
news.summary: Opal Perry joins the rental-car agency as it continues a massive consolidation of its business systems and prepares to roll out updated versions of its core technology.

news.title: Firms to Boost Spending on Smart Automation
news.summary: In the rush to deploy artificial intelligence and robotic process automation, many businesses lack the in-house skills or business strategies to make those investments pay off, KPMG says.

news.title: The Morning Download: GE Seeks Buyer for Parts of Its Massive Software Development Effort
news.summary: Not too long ago, General Electric Co. represented the vanguard of something exciting, combining its traditional business of building big stuff like turbines with a Silicon Valley-like focus on software. Now, GE is putting many of those digital assets up for sale.

news.title: Pentagon Signs $885 Million Artificial Intelligence Contract with Booz Allen
news.summary: The U.S. Department of Defense will for the first time be using large-scale AI systems that could automate mundane tasks and augment the work of military members. The contract also will go toward expanding AI-focused pilot programs, including using AI to find new approaches for treating traumatic brain injuries.

news.title: Microsoft CTO: Edge Computing Can Make Industries ‘Massively More Efficient’
news.summary: “Any of these agricultural or industrial applications, where you have very manual processes like inspections, or humans gathering data … (that’s where) the intelligent edge is going to make those industries massively more efficient,” says Microsoft CTO Kevin Scott.

news.title: What Machine Learning Can and Cannot Do
news.summary: As its domain of applications continues to expand, machine learning is raising serious concerns on its impact on automation and the future of work, CIO Journal Columnist Irving Wladawsky-Berger writes.

news.title: Dow Chemical Digital Chief Helps Shape Massive Restructuring
news.summary: Melanie Kalmar, Dow Chemical’s CDO and CIO, is working closely with other senior leaders to create a new structure designed to help the 121-year-old company better compete in the 21st century. "We are focused on a whole new realm of digitalization – one where we are harnessing the power of our long history of data collection to drive growth and new business opportunities," she said.

news.title: Rush to the Cloud Creates Risk of Overspending
news.summary: By purchasing more cloud computing capacity then they really need, companies across all industries may be overspending on cloud services by an average of 42%, a cloud optimization firm finds.

news.title: Dow Jones Develops Automated Security Tool
news.summary: The new tool, called Hammer, was developed partly in response to the growing need for automation amid talent shortages and the fast-paced nature of software development, said Dow Jones CISO Jaswinder Hayre.

news.title: Cloud Migration Set to Ramp Up in China
news.summary: Compared to U.S. companies, businesses in China have been slower to embrace cloud computing, citing the cost and complexity of migrations, as well as added security and regulatory issues, McKinsey reports.

news.title: Walmart CIO Looks to Microsoft Cloud as Vehicle in Digital Race
news.summary: Walmart CIO Clay Johnson said the company’s new pact with Microsoft will allow the retailer to take advantage of artificial intelligence and cloud capabilities as it competes in a rapidly changing market.

news.title: The Houston Astros and the Transformative Power of Analytics
news.summary: The next wave in baseball? Quite possibly big data combined with AI, says CIO Journal Columnist Irving Wladawsky-Berger.

news.title: Intuition, Emotional Skills of Humans Will Still Prevail in the Age of AI, Experts Say
news.summary: Artificial intelligence is poised to help enterprises automate processes and quickly mine large quantities of data for insights, but human workers will still be invaluable, said panelists at an AI conference Wednesday.

news.title: Firms Look to Emerging Tech to Drive New Business Models
news.summary: Deep learning, augmented reality and quantum computing are among a new breed of digital capabilities that CIOs are eyeing to forge innovative lines of business, Forrester Research reports.

news.title: UPS IT Chief Says Analytics Project Will Improve Logistics Planning
news.summary: UPS is betting on an analytics and machine learning project to gather and consolidate data from various applications within the company’s logistics network. “The more real-time data we can get on the state of a package, the better visibility we can get about any exceptions in the network,” says Juan Perez, chief information and engineering officer.

news.title: TD Ameritrade Offers $100,000 Bounty for New AI Tools
news.summary: The company on Monday launched a competition that will award $100,000 total to innovators who develop technology that can improve the experience for 7,000 independent registered investment advisors that use its software, as well as their clients.

news.title: Microsoft Azure Gains on Amazon Web Services in Cloud Market
news.summary: Large firms continue to put more money into Amazon.com’s cloud services, though Microsoft is closing the gap, Goldman Sachs reports.

news.title: Facebook’s ‘Chief Buzzkill’ Strikes Again
news.summary: Finance chiefs are often the bearers of bad news during earnings calls, with share prices reaping the consequences. Facebook’s CFO Dave Wehner learned that lesson the hard way.

news.title: The Morning Ledger: Chinese Investors Lose Appetite for U.S. Assets
news.summary: Chinese investments in the U.S. declined in 2017, GE seeks a buyer for parts of its digital unit and BMW is building a new assembly plant in Hungary.

news.title: Trump Organization Finance Chief Called to Testify Before Grand Jury
news.summary: Allen Weisselberg, a longtime financial gatekeeper for President Trump, has been subpoenaed to testify in the criminal probe of Mr. Trump’s former personal lawyer, Michael Cohen.
news.byline: Rebecca Davis O’Brien, Rebecca Ballhaus, Michael Rothfeld and Alexandra Berzon

news.title: Godiva Names Former Burberry Executive as New CFO
news.summary: Godiva Chocolatier has hired Virginie Costa as chief financial officer at the Brussels-based maker of chocolates and other confectioneries.

news.title: Finance Chiefs Say Too Much Data Is Making It Harder to Manage Risks
news.summary: Corporate finance chiefs say forming a cohesive and complete assessment of a company from proliferating data streams in an increasingly digital workplace has emerged as a top challenge.

news.title: Investor Proposals Get Sharper, Garner More Support
news.summary: Shareholder proposals -- a key tool that investors use to steer corporate decision making -- have fallen in number but are better at hitting the mark, according to a report by law firm Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP.

news.title: New U.K. Governance Code Focuses on Reporting, Executive Remuneration
news.summary: The U.K.’s largest companies were asked to improve the quality of their financial reporting as part of the new corporate governance rules released by the Financial Reporting Council on Monday.

news.title: How CFO Paul Woolf Steered Mitie to a Turnaround
news.summary: Mitie Group PLC’s rising revenue and improving order book are signs of turning fortunes for the struggling U.K. facility management company that finance chief Paul Woolf joined in November 2017.

news.title: WD-40 Feels Little Impact from Trade Tensions
news.summary: Trade tariffs ultimately hurt consumers and allow some companies to disguise unrelated price increases, said Jay Rembolt, finance chief of WD-40 Co.

news.title: Earnings of Middle-Market Private Companies Jump 12.6% in Q2
news.summary: Earnings growth surged for U.S. private middle-market companies in the first two months of the second quarter, according to a report by Golub Capital, a lender to these companies.

news.title: Digital Transformation Could Add New Jobs – Survey
news.summary: More finance chiefs are looking to add workers to aid in the transformation toward a more digital workplace rather than reduce headcount, according to new report.

news.title: Tax Savings Boost Company Funding for Pensions
news.summary: Finance chiefs are giving pension-risk transfers a second look after the U.S. tax overhaul and favorable tax treatment has spurred pension contributions.

news.title: Philips Looks for Bolt-On Targets While Cutting Costs
news.summary: Dutch technology company Koninklijke Philips NV is scouting for bolt-on acquisition targets while advancing its cost-savings program, Chief Financial Officer Abhijit Bhattacharya told CFO Journal.

opinion.title: The Run on Iran’s Rial
opinion.summary: The currency is falling and inflation is rising as renewed sanctions loom.

opinion.title: Kavanaugh’s Confirmation Progress
opinion.summary: Rand Paul announces support while Senate Democrats punt.

opinion.title: Trump, Putin and the Montenegro Question
opinion.summary: NATO’s newest member vexes Russia and occasions unsettling comments from the U.S. president.

opinion.title: Trump’s Lose-the-House Strategy
opinion.summary: He might not mind Speaker Pelosi as a political foil for 2020.

life.title: MoviePass to Raise Prices, Limit Access to Top Films
life.summary: A standard subscription plan for MoviePass will cost $14.95 a month, up from $9.95, within the next 30 days.

life.title: The NBA’s Billion-Dollar Bear Market
life.summary: It became clear this summer that the league now has a curious economy: NBA salaries are reflections, more than ever before, of when players happened to be free agents.

life.title: A Paralyzed Veteran Gets Back on His Bike
life.summary: A paraplegic U.S. Army veteran and a team of helpers spent nearly five months modifying a motorcycle to put him on the road in time for the Sturgis rally.

life.title: Have You Met This Cow? He’s Delicious.
life.summary: Consumers are demanding to know more about their meat, but it’s a fine line between transparency and oversharing.

life.title: The Future of Watches: 3-D Printed Cases and Robot Horologists
life.summary: Though it might seem like an old-school industry, the world of watchmaking is beginning to embrace techy innovations that improve accuracy and reduce wear and tear.

life.title: A New Life for Neil Gaiman’s ‘Sandman’
life.summary: Thirty years after Neil Gaiman created ‘Sandman,’ his memorable series will be expanded into a new line of comics by others.

life.title: Forget Photo Shoots. Why GQ and Gucci are Betting on Culty Podcasts
life.summary: In an increasingly post-print world, fashion brands and publications are finding new audiences through podcasting.

life.title: The Man Behind Winnie the Pooh Speaks Up, Gently
life.summary: Jim Cummings has spoken for more than 400 animated characters on such movies as “Who Framed Roger Rabbit,” “Aladdin” and “The Princess and the Frog.” For him, however, Winnie the Pooh and Tigger have proved to be the roles of a lifetime.

life.title: Feed Your Head: Foods That Target Depression and Anxiety
life.summary: Based on mounting research, doctors are prescribing nutrient-rich foods as a recipe for better mental health. With the help of high-profile chefs, they’re doing it deliciously, too.

life.title: A Getaway to the ‘Tuscany of America’
life.summary: The Palouse—a scenic farm region on the Washington-Idaho border—is often compared to Tuscany, but with pie shops and ice-cream socials.

life.title: 2019 BMW X4: Skip the Upgrades
life.summary: Is a bigger, badder engine actually worth the extra price? What about driver’s assist and damper control? Dan Neil drives two versions of BMW’s latest X4 and considers the real costs of upselling.

life.title: 10 Decorators’ Best and Worst Buys
life.summary: Design professionals reveal the smartest décor purchases they’ve ever made (midcentury finds on Craigslist), and the most regrettable (a stinky ottoman). What you can learn from their admissions.

life.title: Wine Anxiety: The Top Fears When It Comes to Wine
life.summary: Buying wine can feel like a game of roulette. Will it be corked? Oxidized? Overpriced? Our wine columnist talks to pros and novices alike to investigate their wine worries.

life.title: Gingham’s New Chic: We’re Not in Kansas Anymore
life.summary: Although the homespun checked fabric is most often associated with Dorothy Gale and a bucolic past, designers are now using gingham in surprising high-end ways.

life.title: The Man Quietly Saving Heavy Metal
life.summary: Andy Sneap is making classic heavy-metal stalwarts like Judas Priest and Accept sound cool again.

life.title: You’re Not Too Old for a Tattoo
life.summary: The new tattooed man is just as likely to get around by private jet as by Harley-Davidson. How to ink elegantly.

life.title: The Most Innovative Chefs in Lyon, France’s Gastronomic Capital
life.summary: A new generation of young chefs is turning Lyon, France’s tradition-bound second city, into a destination for creative cooking. Here’s where to start your gluttony tour.

life.title: Leonardo in an Art Workshop: The Boy Most Likely to Succeed
life.summary: A new exhibition at Yale shows the artist’s staggering gifts as he trained in the workshop of Andrea del Verrocchio in Florence.

life.title: The Streaming Age Is Upon Us—and It’s Going to Get Ugly
life.summary: Streaming was supposed to save us money, but Americans could end up paying more than their old cable bills to get all the new services coming online.

life.title: Salman Rushdie’s New Novel Jumps Into Presidential Politics
life.summary: In Salman Rushdie’s novel “The Golden House,” out Sept. 5, a tycoon from India reinvents himself in Manhattan as the Obama years end and the Trump administration begins.

life.title: A Rapper Sends a Suicide Lifeline
life.summary: The rapper Logic’s anthem titled ‘1-800-273-8255’ drives calls to a suicide hotline—while fueling the artist’s breakthrough on the hit-music charts.

life.title: ‘Polina’ Review: Risky Leaps, Moving Odyssey
life.summary: From a husband-and-wife team comes an emotionally compelling, brilliantly acted film about a Russian dancer.

life.title: John le Carré Returns to George Smiley’s World
life.summary: John le Carré brings back George Smiley in the Cold War novelist’s sequel to ‘The Spy Who Came In From the Cold.’

life.title: You Don’t Know George Bernard Shaw Till You’ve Seen Him
life.summary: Reading a play is one thing, but to truly understand the work requires a trip to the theater.

life.title: A Surprise Dance Album
life.summary: Joshua Homme opens up ‘the steam valve for joy’ on Queens of the Stone Age’s seventh album.

life.title: Current Memoirs Hinge on Harrowing Pasts
life.summary: A spate of memoirs by women detail various forms of abuse in their families and marriages.

life.title: The Case for Kendrick Lamar

life.summary: From wild turkeys that crashed a home showing and a stare-down with a startled moose, property brokers recall their encounters with critters.

life.summary: Luxury developers are touting wellness real estate, offering private and communal spaces for meditation and yoga.

life.summary: Existing-home sales slipped 0.6% in June from the previous month

life.summary: Floral designer Lindsey Taylor captures the high-contrast sun and shadow in the American realist painter’s “The Lighthouse at Two Lights,” (1929).

life.summary: Francesco Molinari won the British Open after adopting routines designed to simulate the pressure of competition.

life.title: Why More Position Players Are Pitching
life.summary: An occurrence once viewed as the ultimate novelty in baseball has suddenly become commonplace as teams seek to save their bullpens.

life.title: The Lost Art of Switch Hitting
life.summary: In 1992, switch hitters accounted for nearly 20% of the plate appearances across baseball. The number sits at 13% this season and will almost certainly decline.

life.title: Cycling’s Best Performance Enhancer: The Peloton

life.title: Bryce Harper Is Limping Toward Free Agency

life.summary: Tiger Woods shot an even-par 71 to finish the first round of the British Open five shots behind leader Kevin Kisner. It was the first time he started a major at par or under since the 2014.

life.title: The Beauty of Carnoustie Is Ugly Golf

life.title: At the British Open, the Luck of Draw Could Determine Winner

life.summary: NBA, college and youth basketball teams have begun using a product designed by former Apple engineers for shot-tracking. The app requires a phone and a hoop—and that’s it.

life.title: The Biggest Takeaways From the 2018 World Cup
life.summary: The 2018 World Cup will likely influence the game for years thanks to a series of transformative developments that took place in Russia and fundamentally changed what we know about international soccer.

life.title: France Wins the World Cup
